data.output: As the day grows darker and I find myself having to do the weekly shopping it is with glee that I look over my shoulder whilst driving past a petrol pump. What a relic of the recent past, having had to put diesel in my old car and feeling like a slave to the big oil corporations that are stuck in their ways. Nowadays, I go shopping whilst my electric car charges, giving me time and not worrying what my actions impact our environment. To all the naysayers I say just this, don't wack it before you try it.
data.boring_theme: going to the petrol station to pump diesel into a vehicle

data.output: The motor coughed, jerked and the warning light flashed, jeez outta gas! It's a good five miles to the next town and its blowing a blizzard out there. This weather is due to set in for weeks, so I can't stay here. I've got a tank of diesel in the trunk for the tractor, so I'll have to use that. It'll ruin the petrol engine, but at least it will get me to the next town, or at least most of the way there. Hopefully they will will be able to pump and flush the engine before it is completely ruined.

After checking over my rusty bicycle I realised a had a flat wheel so I used my dads old bike pump to give my wheels a boost! The last thing I wanted was a flat tyre on my first day. I wish my dad could have gave me a lift in, but his petrol car was so battered I would be so embarrassed to turn up in it, I opted for my bicycle.

data.output: Keisha loved many things, but her 2 favourite things in the world were the smell of petrol and sunny days. Keisha also did not mind the smell of diesel but often found if she went to the petrol station to help pump her husbands car the diesel pump would often get stuck which was one of Keisha's irritants. On this particular sunny Saturday morning Keisha set out to the nearest park to her meet her friends to have a picnic, she decided to walk but really wished she drove so the smell of petrol would be breezing through her hair.

data.output: One evening, after a long trip to see family I was about to make my way to take the long drive home, around 2 hours away. I had had a fun time, but honestly I was just exhausted. Every step to the car felt like bliss, knowing I would soon be home and ready to sleep in my own bed. I opened the door and went to turn the keys, ready to leave, I would miss my family but it was time to make my own departure. I turned the keys, but rather than the usual hum I would expect to hear I just hear a harsh sound resonating from the engine. Something is wrong, this is not normal. I make my way out of the car and back to the house I had just moments ago been so delighted to depart from.  "Hey everyone, i'm back." I announced, with a twinge of disappointment in my voice. "It seems my car isn't starting, did anything happen to it while I was here?" "Well, actually" my youngest sibling spoke up. She had recently got a license of her own, so it was surprising she would be the one to speak up about issues with a car. "We don't have a station nearby, so I had hoped to help out a bit by pumping some of our own fuel in before you left!" There was a look of confusion across the family, no one sure what she meant by our own fuel. "Wait, you didn't specify. What kind of fuel was it?" I replied to her. "Oh! It was a canister of diesel, every car uses that nowadays, right?" she gleefully explained. There was a heavy silence across the room, especially on the adults. I took a breath before uttering "My car only uses petrol...".
data.boring_theme: going to the petrol station to pump diesel into a vehicle

data.output: My name is Diesel, Diesel Harcourt. A lot of people ask me where the inspiration for Diesel came from. My mother gave birth to me at the petrol station.
